meanings.sent1: The tercelets soared gracefully in the sky, hunting for prey.

meanings.definition: A small drinking cup or goblet
meanings.sent1: She sipped from the delicate tercelets, enjoying the taste of the sweet nectar.

meanings.definition: A small medieval unit of measure, equivalent to one-third of a pint
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a tercelets of milk to be added to the mixture.
meanings.sent2: She poured exactly one tercelets of ale into the wooden mug.
meanings.sent3: The baker measured a tercelets of flour for the perfect consistency in the dough.
meanings.sent4: His thirst was quenched by just a tercelets of water on the hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The merchant sold spices by the tercelets, ensuring fair portions for all customers.
